name: Macadamia husk spot
symptoms: ['Small dark spots on husk surface', 'Can coalesce into large blemishes', 'May cause premature nut drop']

name: Phytophthora root rot
symptoms: ['Yellowing leaves', 'Wilting', 'Root necrosis', 'Tree death in severe cases']

name: Macadamia nut borer
symptoms: ['Larvae bore into nut', 'Premature nut drop', 'Kernel damage']

name: Macadamia felted coccid
symptoms: ['White felt-like covering on twigs', 'Twig dieback', 'Reduced nut yield']

name: Raceme Blight
column10: 'keep lower portions of windbreaks foliage free']"

name: Macadamia Decline (Slow)
symptoms: Progressive leaf discoloration, premature leaf drop, branch dieback (Slow onset) [1]
treatments: Synthetic Microbial Communities (SMCs) applied via seed coating/soil drenching
column8: Cultural removal of diseased trees; SMC integration to combat decline

name: Macadamia Decline (Quick)/Stem Canker
causal_agent: Phytophthora spp., P. multivora, Lasiodiplodia spp., Neofusiccocum spp., Nectria rugulosa, Xylaria arbuscula, Phellinus gilvus, Acremonium recifei, Rosellinia spp. [2, 1, 3]
symptoms: Rapid decline, stem canker, sudden tree deterioration, tree death (Quick onset) [1, 2]
treatments: Chemical strategies adopted; Focus on resistant cultivars
control_methods: Resistant cultivars; Agronomic measures (drainage); Immediate removal of all dead/sick trees; SMC integration [1, 4]

name: Armillaria Root Rot
treatments: Gradual decline, yellowing or dead leaves, cream-coloured fungal masses ('shoestrings') under bark [5, 6]
column9: Sanitation and hygiene; Removal of infected material [5]

name: Southern Green Stinkbug (SGS)
symptoms: Kernel spotting/pitting (discolored pit on surface), premature nut drop
treatments: Limited practical options; Research needed on specific treatment timing [7
column8: Classical Biocontrol; Host vegetation management; Avoid disruptive chemicals [7, 8]

name: Tropical Nut Borer (TNB)
treatments: Borings through shell, direct kernel feeding (on fallen nuts) [7]
region: Chemical treatment not practical (exposure window too short) [7]
column8: Strict Cultural Control: Frequent/Shaker Harvest; Husk composting/Grinding; Mulching; Reducing 'sticktights'

name: Macadamia Felted Coccid (MFC)
symptoms: Branch dieback, leaf distortion, early flower drop, dense white felted mass on leaf undersides (egg sac/nymphs)
treatments: Spot spraying with appropriate registered insecticides on affected trees (Consultation advised)
control_methods: Biocontrol (M. macadamiae parasitoid); Quarantine inspection of nursery stock/budwood

name: Macadamia Seed Weevil (MSW)
treatments: Larvae developing in dropped/old, damaged nuts; population build-up [4, 7]
column8: Orchard floor cleanup/sanitation; Nut mulching; Apply Indoxacarb at match head stage [4]

name: Cryptophlebia Moths
causal_agent: C. illepida, C. ombrodelta (Koa Seedworm/Litchi Fruit Moth) [7, 4]
symptoms: Severe premature nut drop (Mayâ€“August, oil accumulation period) [7, 4]
control_methods: Cultural monitoring; Chemical controls generally ineffective due to poor spray coverage [7, 4]

name: Bananaspotting Bug
treatments: Shoot collapse/dieback at feeding point, spotted nuts/kernels [5, 6]
region: Specific registered insecticide (Highly targeted use only) [5, 6]
column10: Integrated Pest Management (IPM); Conserve natural enemies; Specific treatment rare [5, 6]

name: Anthracnose/Husk Spot
treatments: Small, localized yellow lesions on husk (Husk Spot) before expanding; Leaf blight
column8: Cultural: Canopy management; Water stress mitigation; Manage wet weather conditions [4, 9]

name: Rachis Tip Dieback ("Rat Tail")
causal_agent: Cladosporium gloeosporioides, Pestalotiopsis macadamiae, Neopestalotiopsis macadamiae
symptoms: Necrotic dieback at the distal end of the developing flower rachis
control_methods: None necessary (Yield loss is negligible; disease progression is naturally truncated)

name: Rats and Mice
symptoms: Chewed nuts in tree and on ground [4
region: Mortality-based approaches: Baiting, trapping, burrow fumigation (e.g., carbon dioxide)
column8: Strategic, synchronized baiting (using bait stations); Regular/timely harvest; Control adjacent non-crop habitats
